results.title: Send me no flowers
results.creator_credit: Norman Jewison, Harry Keller, Universal Pictures and Martin Melcher Productions
results.brief_description: Rock Hudson and Doris Day are the perfect suburban couple and except for Rock’s paranoic hypochondriac tendencies, are extremely happy. That is until one day when Rock believes his death is imminent and enlists the help of buddy Tony Randall to make sure that Doris will be looked after once he is gone. Rock attempts to matchmake Doris with an old college flame (Clint Walker). This is considered to be one of the best Day-Hudson comedies. Watch for Paul Lynde as the cemetary plot salesman.

results.title: Semiotics of the Kitchen
results.brief_description: Semiotics of the Kitchen is a feminist parody single-channel video and performance piece released in 1975 by Martha Rosler. The video, which runs six minutes, is considered a critique of the commodified versions of traditional women’s roles in modern society.

constellations_other.name: Access to resistance
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how access to new recording devices has inspired guerilla filmmaking and protest, helping challenge cultural, societal and political norms.

results.title: Seminar with Ray Harryhausen
results.brief_description: A tape recording of a seminar at the Cinemedia Treasury Theatre with Ray Harryhausen sponsored by The Brisbane International Animation Festival. Ray Harryhausen is a much acclaimed cult figure and celebrated artist and has influenced large bodies of work in the film canon as a whole. His contributions to stop-motion animation have been the inspiration for an entire generation of animators and special effects artists. In 1992, Ray Harryhausen was awarded the Gordon E. Sawyer Academy Award for special achievement from the Academy of Motion Picture Arts & Sciences. As the presenter of the award, Tom Hanks remarked, "some say Citizen Kane is the greatest motion picture of all time, others say it’s Casablanca, for me the greatest picture of all time is JASON AND THE ARGONAUTS." Ray is best known for his work with dinosaurs in ONE MILLION YEARS BC AND THE VALLEY OF GWANGI, the battling skeleton armies in JASON AND THE ARGONAUTS, and the Sinbad series, THE SEVENTH VOGAGE OF SINBAD, THE GOLDEN VOYAGE OF SINBAD and SINBAD AND THE EYE OF THE TIGER. The seminar includes a presentation of his early puppet work, highlights from some of his feature films, display of animation models, pre-production drawings, Q & A and autograph sessions.

results.title: Semiconductor physics. Part 5. The Transistor
results.creator_credit: Eric Wylam, Hindle Marriott Edgar and World Wide Animation
results.brief_description: An explanation of the behaviour of a two-junction (p-n-p) semiconductor device and the necessity for a thin base region, concluding with an explanation of the amplifying action of a transistor. Intended for technical colleges and universities

results.title: Semi-micro analysis
results.brief_description:
The apparatus and technique of semi-micro analysis; comparisons with conventional analysis, and demonstrations in the use of apparatus.
Silent film with English intertitles, produced by the Department of Chemistry.

results.title: Semi-conductors. Part II. Low frequency amplification
results.brief_description: Shows the fundamentals of low frequency amplification; electron and hole flow, F-N junction characteristics and transistor symbols; build up of amplifying circuits; an analysis of the operation of the common emitter and common base circuit.

results.title: Semi-conductors. Part I. Diodes and triodes
results.brief_description: The basic physics and theory of hole and electron flow in semi-conductor material as related to the P.N. junction. Basic transistor or triode operating characteristics show how and why it is an amplifying device.

results.title: Selma
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2014
results.brief_description: “Selma,” as in Alabama, the place where segregation in the South was at its worst, leading to a march that ended in violence, forcing a famous statement by President Lyndon B. Johnson that ultimately led to the signing of the Civil Rights Act.

constellations_other.name: MLK/FBI: blackness In America
constellations_other.description: Award-winning documentarian Sam Pollard looks at J. Edgar Hoover and the FBI’s pursuit of Martin Luther King Jr in the lead-up to his assassination during America’s Civil Rights Movement of the sixties.

constellations_other.name: Confronting injustice on-screen
constellations_other.description: The Black Lives Matter movement and the treatment of African Americans at the hands of authorities is explored in this Constellation that connects hip-hop, the Civil Rights Movement and representation in Hollywood.

results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2014

results.title: Selling your personality [B&W]
results.brief_description: Part of a sales training series this episode shows the right and wrong methods of retail selling. It demonstrates various examples of the type of courteous and sincere customer service that results in sales and resales.
